com.samskivert.jdbc

Interface ConnectionProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataSourceConnectionProvider, StaticConnectionProvider

    public interface ConnectionProvider
    As the repository aims to interface with whatever database pooling services a project cares to use, it obtains all of its database connections through a connection provider. The connection provider provides connections based on a database identifier (a string) which identifies a particular connection to a particular database. A user of these services would then coordinate the database identifier (or identifiers) used to invoke a database operation with the database connections that are returned by the connection provider that they provided to the repository at construct time.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection(String ident,
                         boolean readOnly)
                  throws PersistenceException
        Obtains a database connection based on the supplied database identifier. The repository expects to have exclusive use of this connection instance until it releases it. This connection will be released subsequently with a call to releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection) or connectionFailed(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection, java.sql.SQLException) depending on the circumstances of the release. close() will not be called on the connection. It is up to the connection provider to close the connection when it is released if appropriate.
        Parameters:
        ident - the database connection identifier.
        readOnly - whether or not the connection may be to a read-only mirror of the repository.
        Returns:
        an active JDBC connection (which may have come from a connection pool).
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - thrown if a problem occurs trying to open the requested connection.

      • releaseConnection

        void releaseConnection(String ident,
                       boolean readOnly,
                       Connection conn)
        Releases a database connection when it is no longer needed by the repository.
        Parameters:
        ident - the database identifier used when obtaining this connection.
        readOnly - the same value that was passed to getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) to obtain this connection.
        conn - the connection to release (back into the pool or to be closed if pooling is not going on).

      • connectionFailed

        void connectionFailed(String ident,
                      boolean readOnly,
                      Connection conn,
                      SQLException error)
        Called by the repository if a failure occurred on the connection. It is expected that the connection will be disposed of and subsequent calls to getConnection will return a freshly established connection to the database.
        Parameters:
        ident - the database identifier used when obtaining this connection.
        readOnly - the same value that was passed to getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) to obtain this connection.
        conn - the connection that failed.
        error - the error thrown by the connection (which may be used to determine if the connection should be closed or can be reused).

      • getTxConnection

        Connection getTxConnection(String ident)
                    throws PersistenceException
        Returns a connection that can be used in a transaction. See getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean). Note: transaction connections are never read-only. What would be the point?
        Throws:
        PersistenceException

      • releaseTxConnection

        void releaseTxConnection(String ident,
                         Connection conn)
        Releases a connection obtained by getTxConnection(java.lang.String). See releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection).

      • txConnectionFailed

        void txConnectionFailed(String ident,
                        Connection conn,
                        SQLException error)
        Reports failure of a connection obtained by getTxConnection(java.lang.String). See connectionFailed(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection, java.sql.SQLException).

      • getURL

        String getURL(String ident)
        Returns the URL associated with this database identifier. This should be the same value that would be used if getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) were called.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down this connection provider, closing all connections currently in the pool. This should only be called once all active connections have been released with releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection).
